title: Arrange Your Apple Devices for the Gram
titlettemple: Personally I just make sure that
texttemple: Personally I just make sure that anything that impacts the height as a callback that I can feed into the instance useEffect. So stuff like font loader and location (for route change). Anything that is lazyloaded you can attach update() to it so that it run once the component is rendered
text: Personally I just make sure that anything that impacts the height as a callback that I can feed into the instance useEffect. So stuff like font loader and location (for route change). Anything that is lazyloaded you can attach update() to it so that it run once the component is rendered. I've made an update using useRef to ensure we mount and demount the one and only instance of Locomotive Scroll we need + it let us removes useState which is not perf in our case. I also added a resize-observer to watch height modifications and update the scroll as @mxmtsk suggested - https://github.com/locomotivemtl/locomotive-scroll/issues/13#issuecomment-774568954

text: Cities, buildings, parks and landscapes define the setting of our everyday life. Some are fascinating works of art, and no other man made artefacts document the evolution of social relations, economic trends, technological innovations, philosophical views on man and nature, politics and culture more eloquently than architecture and urbanism. Cities and buildings impact our everyday lives. They define where and how we live, how far we have to travel to reach our working places, our daily rhythms of our movements, the things we see when we are on our way. Their impact on is self-evident â€“ urban planners gave us our sewage systems, architects decent public housing andcare buildings. This master track provides students a rich and varied introduction in the history and theory of architecture and urban planning. Sincecare architecture requires a thorough understanding of the history and theory of architecture, and the world ofy cities can only be analyzed against the background of urbanism, the Expertise Centre Architecture, Urbanism and is embedded in a classical approach of architectural and urban history and theory. It allows students to specialize in classical history and theory, the impacts of architecture and urbanism, or a mixture.

Anything that is lazyloaded you can attach update() to it so that it run once the component is rendered. I've made an update using useRef to ensure we mount and demount the one and only instance of Locomotive Scroll we need + it let us removes useState which is not perf in our case. I also added a resize-observer to watch height modifications and update the scroll as @mxmtsk suggested - https://github.com/locomotivemtl/locomotive-scroll/issues/13#issuecomment-774568954
